name: POST_sso-integrations
description: **This endpoint allows you to create an SSO integration.**

completed_integration.description: Indicates if the integration is complete.

enabled.description: Indicates if the integration is enabled.

entity_id.description: An identifier provided by your IdP to identify Twilio SendGrid in the SAML interaction. This is called the "SAML Issuer ID" in the Twilio SendGrid UI.

name.description: The name of your integration. This name can be anything that makes sense for your organization (eg. Twilio SendGrid)

signin_url.description: The IdP's SAML POST endpoint. This endpoint should receive requests and initiate an SSO login flow. This is called the "Embed Link" in the Twilio SendGrid UI.

signout_url.description: This URL is relevant only for an IdP-initiated authentication flow. If a user authenticates from their IdP, this URL will return them to their IdP when logging out.

$ul: **completed_integration**: Indicates if the integration is complete.
**enabled**: Indicates if the integration is enabled.
**entity_id**: An identifier provided by your IdP to identify Twilio SendGrid in the SAML interaction. This is called the "SAML Issuer ID" in the Twilio SendGrid UI.
**name**: The name of your integration. This name can be anything that makes sense for your organization (eg. Twilio SendGrid)
**signin_url**: The IdP's SAML POST endpoint. This endpoint should receive requests and initiate an SSO login flow. This is called the "Embed Link" in the Twilio SendGrid UI.
**signout_url**: This URL is relevant only for an IdP-initiated authentication flow. If a user authenticates from their IdP, this URL will return them to their IdP when logging out.

**audience_url**: The URL where your IdP should POST its SAML response. This is the Twilio SendGrid URL that is responsible for receiving and parsing a SAML assertion. This is the same URL as the Single Sign-On URL when using SendGrid.
**id**: A unique ID assigned to the configuration by SendGrid.
**last_updated**: A timestamp representing the last time the configuration was modified.

**single_signon_url**: The URL where your IdP should POST its SAML response. This is the Twilio SendGrid URL that is responsible for receiving and parsing a SAML assertion. This is the same URL as the Audience URL when using SendGrid.
